intro: Prenanthes purpurea subsp. tenuifolia, commonly known as slender-leaved water hemlock, is a herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in wetlands and moist soils, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbrella-like clusters, and it produces small, bladder-like fruits. Due to its toxic compounds, it should be handled with care.
